meanings.definition: To suspend a meeting or session temporarily.
meanings.sent1: The teacher adjourned the class for a short break.
meanings.sent2: The judge adjourned the court until the next day.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels adjourned their gathering when it started to rain.
meanings.sent4: The birds adjourned their chirping as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The workers adjourned their lunch break promptly at noon.

meanings.definition: To postpone or delay a meeting or session to a later time.
meanings.sent1: They adjourned the meeting to next week due to a scheduling conflict.
meanings.sent2: The committee adjourned the discussion on the new policy until further research was done.
meanings.sent3: The kids adjourned their playdate to the weekend when more friends could join.
meanings.sent4: The chef adjourned the cooking class to the following month to accommodate more participants.
meanings.sent5: The team adjourned the game to the next day due to bad weather conditions.
